intro: Blakea macbrydei, commonly known as the MacBryde's Blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
